net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.content

Class PreferencePortal

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.content.PreferencePortal

  • public class PreferencePortal
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class acts as a portal to the app's shared preferences. It provides some convenience wrappers for some of the more commonly-used methods of SharedPreferences; most notably:
    • Getter methods that substitute sane defaults, so you don't have to keep supplying them yourself.
    • Quick methods for writing preference values to a SharedPreferences.Editor; these methods can then be chained with apply() or commit() (though the latter may draw the ire of Lint without a @SuppressLint( "CommitPrefEdits" ) annotation.
    • A set of methods for marshalling integer-value preferences as strings in the app's preferences. This is a workaround for occasional wonky behavior of native integer-value preferences in Android.

    An app may choose to extend this class to further provide easy methods for getting and setting specific preferences.

    Note that this class is basically syntactic sugar; an app can easily do all these things itself, instead. This author accepts no responsibility for any taunting or other lack of respect for using this class to clean up what would otherwise be a pretty tedious coding task. However, in the case of stringified integer values, the class does provide static versions of those methods, for those who don't want to lean heavily on the whole class.

    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.4 (#14)

      • LOG_TAG

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG

      • DEFAULT_BOOLEAN

        public static final boolean DEFAULT_BOOLEAN
        The default value for Boolean preferences. (false)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_INT_NOT_SET

        public static final int DEFAULT_INT_NOT_SET
        A default value for integer fields, which indicates "not set". (-1). Assign this default when your integer preference is intended to be unsigned, but knowing that the value has not been set at all is valuable.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_INT_ZERO

        public static final int DEFAULT_INT_ZERO
        The usual default value for integer fields. (0) The class will choose this default value on its own, but it may be reconfigured with useIntegerDefaultValue(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING
        The default value for string fields. (null

      • getStringifiedInt

        public static int getStringifiedInt(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs,
                                    java.lang.String sKey,
                                    int zDefault)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get the value of an integer preference that is stored as a string.
        Parameters:
        prefs - the app's preferences
        sKey - the preference key
        zDefault - the default value, if not set
        Returns:
        the integer value of the preference
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the preference's value can't be parsed

      • putStringifiedInt

        public static android.content.SharedPreferences.Editor putStringifiedInt(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs,
                                                                         java.lang.String sKey,
                                                                         int z)
        Edit the value of an integer preference that is stored as a string. This method should be chained with either the apply() or commit() method of the preference editor to complete the change.
        Parameters:
        prefs - the app's preferences
        sKey - the preference key
        z - the value to write
        Returns:
        a preference editor which would be chained with either apply() or commit()
